headline: IBM (IBM) Rises Higher Than Market: Key Facts

headline: These 5 Stocks Will Replace Your Job
summary: Back in 1999, when I enlisted in the Marine Corps, my base pay started at less than $1,000 a month. Even after four years and a promotion to corporal, I was making just over $1,300 living paycheck to paycheck. In total, my entire enlistment earned me less than $55,000. headline: Blockchain Technology Market to USD 687.4Billion by 2032, owing to enterprise digital transformation | SNS Insider
summary: Accelerated enterprise adoption and integration across sectorsPune, June 30, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- “The SNS Insider report indicates Blockchain Technology Market size was valued at USD 19.2 billion in 2023 and estimated at USD 687.4 billion in 2032, growing at a CAGR of 48.84% from 2024 to 2032.” The U.S. Blockchain Technology Market was valued at USD 5.6 billion in 2023 and is projected to reach USD 199.3 billion by 2032, growing at a CAGR of 48.68 % during 2024–2032. headline: Behind IBM’s Boldest Bet: The Quantum Test Lab
summary: IBM wants to redefine the future of computing. And inside this ultra-cold, high-tech lab, it’s betting everything on a technology that doesn’t just push the limits of physics—it rewrites them. Welcome to IBM’s Quantum Lab: where the world’s oldest tech company is making its boldest bet yet.

headline: Vietnam's Viettel Group Excels at the Prestigious Global Technology Awards
summary: Recently, Viettel Group, a Vietnam state-owned corporation, won 19 awards at the Globee Awards for Technology 2025, one of the most prestigious international awards in the field of information technology and innovation. Viettel's total awards surpass global tech giants such as Amazon, IBM, Meta, Broadcom, Ivanti, Cisco, and more.

headline: 3 Reasons to Avoid IBM and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: IBM’s 31.4% return over the past six months has outpaced the S&P 500 by 26.9%, and its stock price has climbed to $289.50 per share. This was partly thanks to its solid quarterly results, and the run-up might have investors contemplating their next move.
